file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 52-21-00-04 - PASSENGER-CABIN ESCAPE HATCHES - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL PASSENGER-CABIN ESCAPE HATCHES - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the passenger-cabin escape hatches. B. There are two escape hatches in the passenger cabin. They are installed one on each side of the fuselage, above the wing. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY PASSENGER-CABIN ESCAPE HATCHES - ALL 52-21-00-000-801-A REMOVAL PASSENGER-CABIN ESCAPE HATCHES - ALL 52-21-00-400-801-A INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 52-21-00 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-21-00-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. PASSENGER-CABIN ESCAPE HATCHES - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the passenger-cabin escape hatches. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 52-00-06-910-801-A/200 - SB145-52-0040 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 812 Passenger cabin - LH 822 Passenger cabin - RH D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger-cabin escape hatches I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) For aircraft POST-MOD SB145-52-0040, remove the passenger-cabin escape hatches safety pins (AMM TASK 52-00-06-910-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-21-00 Page 2 of 6 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-003-A CAUTION: • THE RH AND LH ESCAPE HATCHES ARE NOT INTERCHANGEABLE. FOR AIRCRAFT PRE MOD SB145-52-0015 YOU MUST IDENTIFY THE ESCAPE HATCH POSITION UPON ITS REMOVAL. FOR AIRCRAFT POST MOD SB145-52-0015 CHECK THE DECALS IN THE ESCAPE HATCHES TO INSTALL CORRECTLY IN ITS RESPECTIVE PLACE. (1) Open the access panel (2). (2) Pull the handle (1). (3) Remove the passenger-cabin escape hatch. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-21-00 Page 3 of 6 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

HANDLE RH ESCAPE HATCH DET. A RIGHT SIDE DET. B 2. ACCESS PANEL 145AMM520108.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-21-00 Page 4 of 6 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-21-00-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. PASSENGER-CABIN ESCAPE HATCHES - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the passenger-cabin escape hatches. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 52-00-06-910-801-A/200 - PASSENGER-CABIN ESCAPE HATCHES - OPERA- AMM TASK 52-21-00-700-801-A/500 TIONAL CHECK PASSENGER-CABIN ESCAPE-HATCH SUPPORT AMM TASK 52-21-00-820-801-A/500 PINS - ADJUSTMENT SB145-52-0040 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 812 Passenger cabin - LH 822 Passenger cabin - RH D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger-cabin escape hatches EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 52-21-00 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-003-A CAUTION: • THE RH AND LH ESCAPE HATCHES ARE NOT INTERCHANGEABLE. FOR AIRCRAFT PRE MOD SB145-52-0015 YOU MUST IDENTIFY THE ESCAPE HATCH POSITION UPON ITS REMOVAL. FOR AIRCRAFT POST MOD SB145-52-0015 CHECK THE DECALS IN THE ESCAPE HATCHES TO INSTALL CORRECTLY IN ITS RESPECTIVE PLACE. • IF ESCAPE HATCHES OF TWO DIFFERENT AIRCRAFT ARE CHANGED FOR EACH OTHER, IT WILL BE NECESSARY TO DO A CHECK AND ADJUSTMENT OF THESE HATCHES. REFER TO AMM TASK 52-21-00-700-801-A/500 AND AMM TASK 52-21-00-820-801-A/500. (1) Open the access panel (2). (2) Pull the handle (1). CAUTION: WHEN YOU INSTALL THE ESCAPE HATCHES, MAKE SURE THAT THE SEAL AROUND THEM STAYS FULLY AGAINST THE EDGE OF THE AIRFRAME CUT-OUT. AFTER YOU INSTALL THE HATCHES, OPERATE THE HANDLES TO MAKE SURE THAT THE TOP EDGES OF THE HATCHES ARE FREE. (3) Put the passenger-cabin escape hatches in their installation position, in the passenger- cabin. (4) Push the handle (1). CAUTION: OPEN THE OVER WING EMERGENCY HATCH AND MAKE SURE THAT THERE IS NO INTERFERENCE BEFORE FINALLY INSTALL IT. IN CASE OF INTERFERENCE FIT THE EMERGENCY HATCH SURROUNDINGS UNTIL TO ELIMINATE THE INTERFERENCES. (5) Do an operational check ( AMM TASK 52-21-00-700-801-A/500). (6) Close the access panel (2). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) For aircraft POST-MOD SB145-52-0040, install the passenger-cabin escape hatches safety pins (AMM TASK 52-00-06-910-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 52-21-00 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
